$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C11E21, yield 95%. MW: 482.06
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C11E23, yield 95%. MW: 496.08
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C11E16, yield 95%. MW: 454.00
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and

in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C01E21, yield 95%. MW: 447.61
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME141 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C35E21, yield 95%. MW: 463.61
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 95

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0

$DATUM 109-72-8

$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C12E21, yield 95%. MW: 482.06
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C15E21, yield 95%. MW: 526.51

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C03E21, yield 95%. MW: 475.66
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C10E21, yield 95%. MW: 465.6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 18913-36-5

$DATUM 513-44-0
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951644-05-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-244-CAS-16091218
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C30E21, yield 95%. MW: 482.06
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0

$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C38E21, yield 95%. MW: 477.64
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release

dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of

respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C41E21, yield 95%. MW: 461.64

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C46E21, yield 95%. MW: 385.54
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C01E23, yield 95%. MW: 461.64
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C01E30, yield 95%. MW: 431.57
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME159 STEP1
$RXN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C35E23, yield 95%. MW: 477.64
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME161 STEP1

$DATUM 4

$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C12E23, yield 95%. MW: 496.08
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C15E23, yield 95%. MW: 540.53

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C40E23, yield 95%. MW: 496.08
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DATUM 4

$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C03E23, yield 95%. MW: 489.69
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 18913-36-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951762-62-2
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 541-31-1
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951644-39-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-244-CAS-16084015
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C10E23, yield 95%. MW: 479.63
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RXN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 18913-36-5

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 541-31-1
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951644-45-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-244-CAS-16087254
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C30E23, yield 95%. MW: 456.08
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0

$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C38E23, yield 95%. MW: 491.66
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C46E23, yield 95%. MW: 399.57
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME174 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C43E16, yield 95%. MW: 419.56
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release

of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C43E30, yield 95%. MW: 431.57

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 18913-36-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 664985-99-3
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-08-1
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951643-66-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-244-CAS-16065071
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C35E16, yield 95%. MW: 435.56
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME177 STEP1
$RXN

$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C39E16, yield 95%. MW: 449.58
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME179 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C15E16, yield 95%. MW: 498.45
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C40E16, yield 95%. MW: 454.00
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0

$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C05E16, yield 95%. MW: 463.61
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME184 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C10E16, yield 95%. MW: 437.55

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0

$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C25E16, yield 95%. MW: 509.64
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C37E16, yield 95%. MW: 470.00
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C38E16, yield 95%. MW: 449.58

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. B01C41E16, yield 95%. MW: 433.58
