$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME378 STEP1

$DATUM 951635-97-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16083433
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound

of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of

respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

M  V30 END COLLECTION

$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951636-19-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16082975
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2

$DATUM 7087-68-5

$DATUM 14338-32-0

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME387 STEP1
$RXN

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME389 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 863401-19-8
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951636-06-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16064915
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME391 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16086438
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME393 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of

respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951636-04-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16088157
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME397 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951636-21-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16085967
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME402 STEP1
$RXN

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951762-85-9
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951687-88-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16086422
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME404 STEP1
$RXN

$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME406 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951762-90-6
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951687-93-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16085493
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME408 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME410 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of

pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single

benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951687-99-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16081647
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951688-01-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16085068
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME415 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951762-99-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951688-03-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16082292
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME417 STEP1
$RXN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16085263
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME419 STEP1
$RXN

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951688-07-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16088307
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin

phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases

$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME428 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 36253-58-4
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951763-12-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951688-16-7
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16085032
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME430 STEP1
$RXN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
